text: Thanks <@U25PYL3Q8>, I am just starting with HubSpot to be honest, how do you handle this kind of setup? I feel like at the moment is super manual managing multiple env.
Not sure if you are in house or a freelancer. The answer likely matters but I'll just touch on all of it I guess
in house

There are a few ways you can do this right now. If you are using themes you can duplicate your theme and rename it and then duplicate your pages, and put those pages on a different url like the hs sites or portal number domains (these are changed on settings page inside the page editor). 

You can also manage versioning pages inside content staging
All those can be done inside the current portal and can help reduce a lot of the processes you are looking at by using a completely different environment/portal
If you want to manage this stuff across portals you can use HubSpot cli/local development tools to sync you portal code base and push when you need to.
Sorry I'm on mobile it I'd provide a mess load of links and ill likely write up my thoughts on this in a lot more detail over the next week

So blogs between portals, you can Google bluleadz export HubSpot blog and that should get you a decent way to export to csv, then you can import into the other portal as an unknown cms and it works good enough for a staging environment for testing
is there anything like that for Pages?

Pages are difficult because the pages api is difficult. Cta migration is a huge work around. 

It's very difficult to migrate a page out of HubSpot into another portal. Most of the time I'm rebuilding these manually if I need to do this. (I have a tool internally I use that works pretty well, so many hours of time, it uses api keys so we need to rework it). That tool however would only be for testing purposes. It doesn't copy things over 100%
I mean like I would let the marketing team use it to set up pages and then think I could use a tool to push them to the live portal
When it comes to copy/image updates, and changing the theme or the modules of your current page, the best place for that is content staging
I see Nicholas, will dig a bit more about the content staging but I guess there is not a perfect scenario at the moment to have a complete migration for different env.
Thanks for all the guidance here, awesome.

So to round out that answer, if you have the time to invest and felt that having a separate portal for testing of development modules and how they work, and using mostly correct migrated pages (you recreate forms and ctas and maybe I'm missing something), then working in that manner wouldn't be terrible.
But you can accomplish everything in one portal if you have a system
No perfect solution if you want automation.
You are right
I've got a super busy Monday and Tuesday, but I'll have some more information I can share with you that is a bit more detailed.
If you can that would be super helpful
